column1: #Text=The title compound was synthesized as polycrystalline powder from stoichiometric amounts of binary oxides at 1273 K in a sealed quartz tube under argon atmosphere.
#Text=The reagents, SrO2 (Aldrich, 99%) and OsO2 (Sigma Aldrich, 83% Os) were used as received and without any further purifications.
#Text=Fe2O3 was freshly prepared by thermal decomposition of iron acetate (Sigma Aldrich, 95%) in a flow of oxygen at 400o C.
#Text=A typical batch consisted of a stoichiometric mixture of SrO2 (0.239 g), Fe2O3 (0.079 g) and OsO2 (0.222 g), which was ground thoroughly inside a glovebox.
#Text=The starting mixture was pressed into pellets that were placed in corundum containers and finally sealed in quartz tubes under argon atmosphere.
#Text=Pure single phase polycrystalline Sr2FeOsO6 was obtained after 50 hours of heating at 1273 K.
#Text=The heating and cooling rates were kept at 50 K/hour, throughout.
#Text=In order to assure full oxygen occupancies, the product was reheated at 773 K for two days in a gold crucible under 120 MPa oxygen pressures, in a steel autoclave.
